result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danny B. Short

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
FPT adj to 11/29 @ 1:30pm on court's motion; court unavailable on previously scheduled date

09:28 AM   State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant, Danny B. Short, appeared in custody with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 
22CF382: Attorney Schwarz is requesting an adjournment for reasons set forth on the record. Court adjourns.

22TR2315-22TR2317: These matters continue to trail Case 22CF382.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Danny B. Short appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. DE motion to modify bond; arguments heard; Court denies motion. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Assessment of Costs for Expert Lab Analysis and Witness Fees
re: Client's Bond Modification Request filed by Atty Schwarz
at the request of Atty Schwarz, STC is canceled and a PH is scheduled for 04-28 at 8:30am.  DA notified

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant Danny B. Short in court, in custody.  Attorney Tom Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:    SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  If released, Report to WCS by 11:00 the next business day; Submit to random UA's upon request.  Comply w/ all program requirements & provide all required information.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Michael B. Jr.

01:16 PM  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michelle Knapp.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on March 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.  $15,000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  kmk
and witness list filed by the State
